ng junit for my projects.  i have noticed that
checking 
to see if a string=

"asse=
rtContains()" methods to the Assert class?

it would create easier-to-read =
and maintain tests than having to
currently 
do containment checks by writi=
ng

	fail("failed.");
}

s, and for loops.


the methods could be something like:

ring containerString, String searchString)

rArray, String searchString)

archObject, Class
objClass)
